questions.question: What's the most popular JavaScript framework?
What are the building blocks of React?
What's the XML-like JavaScript extension syntax used in React?
How does the one-way data flow work in React?
How do React components communicate with each other?
When we can use the derived state in React
options: The state doesn't have to trigger re-render
The state has to memoize some computations based only on the current props
The state has to be accessible to all the components
The state has to be computed based on the existing state

questions.question: When does a component trigger re-rendering in React?
When we can directly manipulate the DOM in React?
When do we have to pass a function to setState in React?
options: Updating the state will be slow
The updated state is very data-intensive
Updating the state has to happen faster
The new state is computed based on the previous state

questions.question: If we pass a function as "initialState", when will React call our initializer function?
options: Each time the state is updated
The first time the state is updated

questions.question: We want to control a non-React component based on the React state.
Which values have to be declared as a dependency in an Effect?
options: Every reactive value used by the Effect's code
All the values required for cleanup

questions.question: An Effect will always run on the initial render.
options: In depends on the code in the Effect

questions.question: If an Effect doesn't have a dependency, When will the Effect run?
options: The first time the component re-rendered
Each time the component is re-rendered
